def.dt: :to change (something) + obj Alcohol can alter a person's mood. He altered his will to leave everything to his sister. This one small event altered the course of history. no obj The place has altered in the 10 years since I left.
:to make a change to (a piece of clothing) so that it will fit better I'll need to have/get the dress altered before the wedding.
:to remove the sex organs of (an animal) so that the animal is unable to reproduce They had the puppies altered [=fixed] before they were sold.

utxt.vi: Later, we see this character again in a slightly altered form.

def.dt: :a different version of yourself A character in a book or film is sometimes viewed as an author's alter ego. A role that an actor often plays is sometimes described as the actor's alter ego.
:a close friend who thinks or feels similarly to the way you think or feel a trusted adviser who is the President's alter ego
